description.text: The PR-0 Prototype Steam Knight is the first step into Autonomous Steam Tech for the empire; a fully-functioning armored warrior.

gameplay_description.text: Steam Knights automatically defend your colony and are extremely powerful.

description.text: The MK-1 Steam Knight is a truly complete battle weapon, and a massive step up from the PR-0; Armored and armed with a deadly repeating gun, this masterpiece is sure to keep your colony safe.

gameplay_description.text: Steam Knights automatically defend your colony and are extremely powerful.

description.text: Rough hewn timber is the basis for the wood-working industry.

gameplay_description.text: Used for basic buildings and making planks at the Carpentry Workshop

description.text: Raw harvested bamboo may be used like logs for any wood-working application.

gameplay_description.text: Used for basic buildings and making planks at the carpentry workshop

description.text: Timber cut into planks is used to construct basic structures and goods.

gameplay_description.text: Used to build most buildings and many modules.

description.text: This sharp-smelling substance is extracted from plants and beetles and may be used to treat timber for aesthetic and practical improvement.

gameplay_description.text: Used to produce lacquered wood.

description.text: These planks have been treated with a coat of protective - and quite handsome - lacquering.

gameplay_description.text: Used to construct high-end modules, as well as some buildings.

description.text: The standard fuel, coal keeps our industry churning and the Empire steaming onward!

gameplay_description.text: Used as a fuel source and a component of steel.

description.text: A secondary fuel source when coal is not forthcoming, charcoal may be used in place of coal.

gameplay_description.text: Used as a fuel source and a component of steel.

description.text: A crude fuel source used when coal is not forthcoming, peat dug from bogs may be fuel kilns, furnaces, and boilers.

gameplay_description.text: Used as a fuel source.

description.text: A rueful ore of iron brooding heavily 'til it meets the Smelter.

gameplay_description.text: Smelted into iron ingots at a Metalworks.

description.text: A copper ore of characteristic greenish hue.

gameplay_description.text: Smelted into copper ingots at a Metalworks.

description.text: A most curious ore of zinc, named for the Stahlmarkian city of Bad Zinkenburg.

gameplay_description.text: Smelted into zinc ingots at a Metalworks.

description.text: Precious gold is favoured by aristocrats and those who otherwise desire such ostentation.

gameplay_description.text: Smelted into gold ingots ingots at a Metalworks.

description.text: The famed cliffs of Coalsdowne are chalk, but they have not been so white as this in living memory.

gameplay_description.text: Used to produce steel at a Metalworks

description.text: Also called brimstone, sulphur is a potent subtance in both smell and industrial applications.

gameplay_description.text: Sulphur is used in the making of useful products such as Gunpowder at the Chemical Works.

description.text: The old reliable of Modern Industry, iron is a sturdy metal used in many machines, tools, and important structures.

gameplay_description.text: Iron is one of the staple metals of a colony, used for making a great many things in the Metalworks.

description.text: Less common (in the proper sense) than iron, copper is a classical metal often used around water and steam due to its ductility and heat exchange effects.

gameplay_description.text: Copper is used to create plates and pipes required for industrial machines but may also be combined with Zinc Ingots to produce Brass.

description.text: Zinc is a solemn metal - not particularly useful on its own, it yearns to better itself in alloy with copper.

gameplay_description.text: Zinc is combined with Copper Ingots to produce the Brass required for Cogs - A vital ingredient in many machines.

description.text: The Queen of Metals, brass is the very heart of the Empire. Its practicality and beauty have been praised by many a spirited poet (and some, even, when sober).

gameplay_description.text: Brass is essential to the production of Cogs, and thus essential for the creation of advanced machines.

description.text: Gold is favoured by aristocrats. It is most often used to make large, shiny piles of ingots that sit in vaults to back more sensible mediums of exchange.

gameplay_description.text: Gold is used for building ridiculously ostentatious things, mostly. It also sells for obscene amounts.

description.text: An alloy of carbon and iron, Steel is labourious to produce, but the only material strong enough to withstand the full power of advanced Clockworkian Industry.

gameplay_description.text: The ultimate metal, Steel is used in the production of all top-tier modules and products, including the mighty Steam Knight.

description.text: Iron pipes are generally used in industrial machinery and advanced weapons production.

gameplay_description.text: Used for industrial chimneys and weapons at a Metalworks.

description.text: Miners say pipes are the true form of copper - that deep below the ground their pipes grow in honeycombs that dazzle the senses and twist the mind.

gameplay_description.text: Used in the creation of water or steam-based machinery and condensers at a Metalworks.

description.text: Iron plating is a popular and useful component in machinery and armour. As they say, 'One can never have enough iron between oneself and danger.

gameplay_description.text: Used in the construction of most industrial machinery at a Metalworks.

description.text: Copper Plates are generally used in construction of holding tanks and condensation vats, when either a ductile or conductive material is needed.

gameplay_description.text: Used to construct boilers and condensers.

description.text: Hardened steel plates require significant layering to create, but are unparalleled as armor. Rumours swirl about Stahlmarkian invenetions in the field, but our Clockworkian Steel has always seen us through.

gameplay_description.text: Used in the construction of Steam Knights.

description.text: The ultimate end of copper and zinc combined to form something greater than its parts, and shaped into beautiful form: the cog - whether miniscule or mighty - is a highly revered symbol of Progress to the Empire.

gameplay_description.text: Essential for the creation of complex machinery and weapons in a Metalworks.
Essential for the production of Rubber.

description.text: This strange ore is largely unknown to Clockworkian metallurgists, to be honest. We're not sure what it is good for, if anything.

gameplay_description.text: We've been asked by the Republique to refine this strange ore in our smithy.

description.text: An oddly heavy metal, slightly warm, and prone to fits of glowing. The Republicains requested we smelt this, and it is folly, surely.

gameplay_description.text: The Republique will want to take posession of this. Alternatively, we can trade it away.

description.text: Foundation of civilization itself, this ruddy Earth is unfit for farming but perfect to bake into useful products.

gameplay_description.text: Clay can be transformed into bricks or stoneware jars at a Ceramics Workshop.

description.text: The correct sand necessary to produce pure Empire-grade glass is less common than one might imagine.

gameplay_description.text: Can be used to create glass - a vital material for fine goods - at a Ceramics Workshop.

description.text: A fine construction material used in foundations and fireplaces throughout the Empire.

gameplay_description.text: Used in the construction of many buildings, stoves, and kilns.

description.text: Bones of the Earth, useful for simple foundations and certain crude products.

gameplay_description.text: Used to construct solid foundations for frontier structures.

description.text: Crushed bone, very small and powdery.

gameplay_description.text: Gross! Why are you putting bones in a basket like that?

description.text: Assorted bones in a range of sizes and shapes.

gameplay_description.text: Gross! Why are you putting bones in a basket like that?

description.text: 'Instant stone - add water and wait!' it says.

gameplay_description.text: Used for making roads.

description.text: Ceramic jars made for brewed beverages.

gameplay_description.text: Traditionally used to hold beer.

description.text: Shiny glass bottles, useful for preserves, liqueurs, and whatever other interesting fluids one might fancy.

gameplay_description.text: Used to hold distilled liquor and medicinal fluids.

description.text: Produces a hard barrier between inside and out - essential for Civilized Living and certain scientific applications.

gameplay_description.text: Used in the construction of many fine products across a number of workshops.

description.text: A highly volatile keg of explosive powder. Keep away from open flames, please.

gameplay_description.text: Used in a Ceramics Workshop or Metalworks to create landminds and ammo.

description.text: Used for fertilising plants.
Used for fertilising plants.

gameplay_description.text: Used for fertilising plants.

description.text: A crate of stone pellet cartridges. This ammunition is cheap, weak, and easy to produce. It is used in simple Muskets and TriPistols by soldiers, and is used by Naturalists for hunting.

gameplay_description.text: Supplies lowest level weapons (Musket, TriPistol) in Barracks. Supplies a Naturalist for hunting jobs.

description.text: A crate of simple bullet cartridges. This ammunition is practical and economical. It is used by soldiers in Tripistols, Blunderbusses, and Revolvers.

gameplay_description.text: Supplies mid-level weapons (Blunderbuss, Resolver) in the Barracks.

description.text: A crate of full metal jacket minie-style ammunition suitable for rifled firearms. This ammunition is of fine quality. It is used by Soldiers in powerful weapons like the Jezail Rifle, and Carbine.

gameplay_description.text: Supplies powerful weapons (Revolver, Jezail Rifle, Carbine) in Barracks.

description.text: A crate of highly dangerous and fairly experimental explosive munitions. These are not for hand-use (far too many accidents, you see) but via the Grenade Launcher device.
A metal bomb packed with gunpowder which wears a trigger mechanism like a little hat.

gameplay_description.text: Place these where enemies tread and they shall soon trod no more.

description.text: Straw of the fibrous flax plant is often woven into cloth, and is the only cash crop for colonies in the colder territories.

gameplay_description.text: This is a cash crop. It's for trading away to traders.

description.text: Bolts of thick cloth woven from flax.

gameplay_description.text: A useful trade good.

description.text: Timber planks are used to construct a basic coffin.

gameplay_description.text: Used to house corpses for their final rest.

description.text: A bushel of Bluestar Cap Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Cream Cap Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Redspeckle Cap Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Banded Disc Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of White Disc Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Green Puffball Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of White Puffball Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Orange Puffball Fungus.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked or preserved in a Kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of twisted scrap iron which can be smelted back into iron ingots.

gameplay_description.text: Smelt this into iron ingots at a Metalworks.

description.text: A crate full of delicious Science, ready for the researching. At least, you hope it's full of Science.

gameplay_description.text: Used for a 'special research project'.

description.text: A roughly hewn stone wheel used by ancient people to grind grains.

gameplay_description.text: Perhaps this could be sold to traders.

description.text: A fossilized leaf from a time long ago.

gameplay_description.text: Perhaps this could be sold to traders.

description.text: An ornate bell from an ancient civilization.

gameplay_description.text: Perhaps this could be sold to traders.

description.text: The head of a marble statue from antiquity bearing a resemblance to Julius Steeltar.

gameplay_description.text: Perhaps this could be sold to traders.

description.text: A crude geometric form carved from dense, dark stone.

gameplay_description.text: It seems not of this world.

description.text: A fish-like figure crudely carved from yellowed bone or ivory.

gameplay_description.text: It seems not of this world.

description.text: A pod or spore, long dead; stumps protrude from the central mass. It seems not of this world.

gameplay_description.text: It seems not of this world.

description.text: A pod or spore, glowing with life - but not as we know it. It hurts to look at directly.

gameplay_description.text: It seems not of this world.

description.text: A crude vessel of some sort formed of a dense, dark ceramic.

gameplay_description.text: How odd. What could this do?

description.text: A dense, round stone artifact crawling with runes.

gameplay_description.text: How odd. What could this do?

description.text: A putrid basket of fishy-looking organs.
This ancient leathery tome is locked shut, for some reason.

gameplay_description.text: How odd. What could this do?

description.text: A rough chunk of unnatural stoney material.

gameplay_description.text: How odd. What could this do?

description.text: Fused bricks of unnatural stoney material.

gameplay_description.text: How odd. What could this do?

description.text: A box of assorted odds and ends, used for crafting decor modules.

gameplay_description.text: Used to construct modules at a Decor Workbench.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces bricks, glass, and glass products.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces bricks, glass, and glass products in bulk.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces charcoal from wood.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces charcoal from wood.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces cooked food.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces metal pipes in bulk.

gameplay_description.text: Module that refines metals from ores.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces metal from ore.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces planks very efficiently.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces bricks, glass, and glass products in massive bulk.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces charcoal very efficiently.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces basic brewed drinks.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces modules and trade products.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that is used to craft Bricabrac and Decor modules.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that combines function of all other workbenches, produces items in bulk.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces chemically-derived products.

gameplay_description.text: Module that produces metal materials, tools, and weapons.

gameplay_description.text: Module that is used to store alcohol for your colonists to drink from in a pub.

description.text: An ostentatious painting by a certain famous artist - you've probably heard of them. Place this astonishing rarity in a house to increase your population capacity.

description.text: Practical imagery fit for the professional class - you've probably heard of them. Place this in a house to increase your population capacity.

description.text: Practical imagery fit for the professional class - you've probably heard of them. Place this in a house to increase your population capacity.

gameplay_description.text: Place in a house to increase population cap.

description.text: A rude piece of art fit for the lower classes - you've probably heard of them. Place this in a house to increase your population capacity.

gameplay_description.text: Place in a house to increase population cap.

description.text: A rude piece of art fit for the lower classes - you've probably heard of them. Place this in a house to increase your population capacity.

gameplay_description.text: Place in a house to increase population cap.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that crafts Steam Knight Power Cores.

description.text: A boxed module, ready for setting up in an appropriate building.

gameplay_description.text: Module that creates Steam Knights out of various components.

description.text: A large wooden frame used to assist in holding Steam Knight parts as they are assembled.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing Steam Knights.

description.text: A highly complex device, the Spring-Loaded Power Core provides a reserve of kinetic energy for when a Steam Knight must move quickly.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing Steam Knights.

description.text: This metal shell forms the base around which the rest of the Steam Knight will be formed. This prototype model is mostly Iron and is vulnerable to gunfire.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing Steam Knights.

description.text: This metal shell forms the base around which the rest of the Steam Knight will be formed. The MK-1 model is made of hardened steel and highly durable.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing the MK-1 Steam Knight.

description.text: This metal shaping houses a complex array of lenses and gears, forming the 'Head' of the Steam Knight. This prototype model is mostly Iron and is vulnerable to gunfire.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing Steam Knights.

description.text: This metal shaping houses a complex array of lenses and gears, forming the 'Head' of the Steam Knight. The MK-1 model is made of hardened steel and highly durable.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing the MK-1 Steam Knight.

description.text: A big Knight needs a big Gun - this deadly piece is a recent invention by Dutchesss Miriam Minum and is known coloquially as the 'Minum Gun'. It's far too large for a regular person to use, however.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing the MK-1 Steam Knight.

description.text: It was deemed too inefficient to disable the Steam Knight in order to resupply ammunition, and as such the Autoloader Backpack was developed. This device holds all the ammunition a Knight will ever need!

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this in constructing the MK-1 Steam Knight.

description.text: This volatile powder is dual-purpose, as it both assists in the continuing function of the Steam Knight's boiler and acts as propellant for its guns.

gameplay_description.text: The Steam Knight Manufactory uses this to construct Steam Knights.

description.text: A large stack of paper - vital instrument of Bureaucracy and the lifeblood of buildings like the Foreign Office, Naturalist's Office, and Training Academy.

gameplay_description.text: The Foreign Office, Naturalist's Office, and Training academy need this to operate.

description.text: A bucket of cheap ink created from coal. Having proper writing supplies assist your diplomats and trainees significantly.

gameplay_description.text: The Foreign Office and Training Academy are more effective when supplied with ink.

description.text: Mine shorings are all that stand between your miners and a very, very deep grave - make sure to keep a healthy stock to keep your mines running.

gameplay_description.text: These are necessary for the Mine to operate.

description.text: A chest of assorted scientific materials for use in a Laboratory.

gameplay_description.text: These are required for the Laboratory to operate.

description.text: A strange and recent invention, these odd devices channel a strange force known as 'Voltaic Energy'.

gameplay_description.text: These can be studied in a lab to improve its functioning. They may also have other, more unusual uses...

description.text: A highly complex and advanced device, the Steam Compressor allows for the isolation and examination of Aetheric energies.

gameplay_description.text: These can be studied in a lab to improve its functioning. They may also have other, more unusual uses...

description.text: A pile of brittle iron cogs for use in chapel services as votive objects. Not suitable for use in working machinery.

gameplay_description.text: These are necessary to hold Chapel services.

description.text: A bag of crude splints and other supplies required for Frontier Doctoring.

gameplay_description.text: These are required to heal people in your Barbershop.

description.text: Put anything in an oven and you'll get a cooked meal out of it!
The Republiquans have mastered the art of cooking - now we've learned their secrets for ourselves.

gameplay_description.text: Put anything in an oven with some alcohol and you'll get a cooked meal out of it!

description.text: Mm, pie. What kind of pie you get out depends on what gets put into it!.

gameplay_description.text: Colonists love premium food like pies.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of beetle meat.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of beetle meat.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: Laudanum is a curative tonic that helps to stave off despair.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this to your colonists at a pub to keep them happy. Or sane.

description.text: A tin of meat.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A curative tonic made with sulphur.

gameplay_description.text: Supply these to your Barbershop to heal colonists much faster!

description.text: Generic canned food
Delicious soup
A tasty mixed-fruit treat.

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this mildly-fancy food.

description.text: The tasty harvest-time treat.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: Made of stewed vegetables - at least two kinds! - this dish is hardy and nutritious.

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this mildly-fancy food.

description.text: Stewed Cabbage, the Novorusian Treat! It's a bit much for your colonists' palate, but better than biting into cabbage raw...

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: Delicious stew!

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: A rather painful and spicy stew. It's not a pleasant experience, but colonists will grudgingly eat it.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: Fancied by all
A stout beverage brewed to slake the thirst of a long day's work.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy.

description.text: A solid plonk to ease the day's labours.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: A tasty wine made of fermented sugarcane to ease the day's labours.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: Distilled high-proof alcohol made from sugarcane. It helps one to forget.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: Distilled high-proof alcohol. It helps one to forget after a long day's work.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: Distilled high-proof alcohol. It helps people forget.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: Distilled high-proof alcohol from frozen Novorus. Strong enough to strip paint.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: If you drink this you'll turn into a cultist.
If you drink this you'll turn into a yay.
If you drink this you'll turn into a angry.
A foul-smelling potion. Where did this come from?
A brew of fermented maize; it'll do for a night at the pub.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy.

description.text: A brew of femented Agave syrup. It helps people forget.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy.

description.text: Moonshine. White lightning. Hooch. It REALLY helps people forget.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: The distilled spirit of Agave nectar. It REALLY helps people forget.

gameplay_description.text: Serve this at the Pub to make your colonists happy. Or sane.

description.text: A dense loaf of bread, staple of the Lower Classes.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: A bushel of tasty cabbage just asking to be boiled into stew.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of tasty chillies to garnish bland boiled dishes.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: This basket is overflowing with shining black fungus.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: This basket is overflowing with bright orange fungus.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of large fishy eggs.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen... assuming you think that's wise.

description.text: A tin of large fishy eggs. An upper class delicacy!

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this mildly-fancy food. It's also tradeable!

description.text: Raw opium - ready to be turned into healthful medicinal liqueur.

gameplay_description.text: Turn this into Laudanum at a Chemical Works.

description.text: Raw Molasses ready to be cooked into syrup or treacle.

gameplay_description.text: Can be used in some food recipes, or sold.

description.text: Raw Agave Syrup ready to be processed into alcohol.

gameplay_description.text: Turn this into alcohol at a Kitchen.

description.text: Raw harvested sugarcane can be processed into molasses and sugarloaf.

gameplay_description.text: Turn this into molasses and sugarloaf at a Kitchen.

description.text: A cone of sweet, sweet sugar.

gameplay_description.text: Can be used in some cooking recipes, or sold.

description.text: Abundant staple of the Home Counties, wheat can be baked, brewed, and stewed to the delight of any upstanding Clockworkian.

gameplay_description.text: Can be made into bread at a Kitchen or beer at a Distillery.

description.text: Recently discovered on the Frontier, these gourd-like fruits can be boiled into stew.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Discovered on the Frontier, this food is some kind of monstrous, juicy grain.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal or brewed into beer at a kitchen

description.text: A bushel of plump, purple grapes. Perfect for preserves or wine.

gameplay_description.text: Can be cooked into a meal or brewed into wine at a kitchen.

description.text: It's some sort of large, spiny fruit.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen

description.text: Fine tea leaves, staple of Clockworkian civilization.

gameplay_description.text: This can be sold for a good price at a trade depot.

description.text: Plump blue berries which may be boiled into fine preserves or baked into pie.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Lively red berries which may be boiled into fine preserves or baked into pie.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Capsule shaped fruit pods; fleshy with a candy-like flavor.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Some kind of meat, charred beyond recognition.

gameplay_description.text: Don't eat this. Please.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of meat.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of aurochs meat.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of cooked meat.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Naturalists have assured us the fishfolk do not feel pain, so don't worry about it.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen... assuming you think that's a good idea.

description.text: Naturalists have assured us the fishfolk do not feel pain, so don't worry about it.

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this mildly-fancy food.

description.text: A big 'ol slab of fish meat.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Does this taste funny?

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen... assuming you think that's a good idea.

description.text: Does this look familiar? No, perhaps not.

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this food... theoretically.

description.text: A whole raw bird carcass, ready for cooking.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A large, roasted bird.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: As the Ministry puts it 'The tasty treat made from mystery meat'.

gameplay_description.text: Overseers prefer this mildly-fancy food.

description.text: Though perhaps not as prestigious as tea and coffee, tobacco is a widely-grown cash crop.

gameplay_description.text: This can be sold at a trade depot for an excellent price.

description.text: The fruit of the Coffee Plant is not valuable in and of itself, but the beans are worth quite a bit once processed.

gameplay_description.text: Once roasted into coffee beans in a Kitchen, this can be sold at a trade depot for an excellent price.

description.text: The prized product of the coffee plant, this curious bean promotes Industry.

gameplay_description.text: This can be sold at a trade depot for an excellent price.

description.text: Tea leaves are important indeed for any Clockworkian - their production and import is a lucrative trade.

gameplay_description.text: This can be sold at a trade depot for a good price.

description.text: Fine tropical coconuts straight from the tree.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: Sweet Coconut Stew. It's a somewhat cloying meal, but certainly an improvement over raw coconut.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: Simmered, spicy coconut curry.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: Mushy Fungus Stew. It's tolerable, but a bit thin.

gameplay_description.text: Labourers prefer this basic, cooked meal.

description.text: A crate of spicy pickled chillies.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: This basket is overflowing with dull white fungus. It seems to leave spores behind whenever it is moved.

gameplay_description.text: This can be cooked into a meal at a kitchen.

description.text: A bushel of Yellow Disc Fungus. It glistens dankly.
A crate of tasty orange fungus - noted for its lightly floral flavours.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A crate of tasty white fungus - notable for its piquant flavours.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A crate of black fungus - notable for its earthy flavours.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A crate of delicious Lingonberry preserves.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A crate of delicious Saskatoonberry preserves.

gameplay_description.text: Unlike regular food, Trade Foods are preserved and can be sold at a Trade Office.

description.text: A freshly baked Lingonberry Pie bursting with fruity flavour.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: A freshly baked Saskatoonberry Pie bursting with fruity flavour.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: A freshly baked Meat Pie, it is hearty enough to fill the stomach - and heart - of any loyal Clockworkian.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: A freshly baked Fish Pie, it has a strong scent about it.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: As they say, 'Rest in pastry...'

gameplay_description.text: It looks edible.

description.text: It seems to writhe gently in the corner of the eye.

gameplay_description.text: It looks edible.

description.text: Fresh-baked scent wafts alluringly about this pie.

gameplay_description.text: Aristocrats prefer this wonderfully made meal.

description.text: A bizarre cube of raw flesh. It is unknown whence this came.

gameplay_description.text: It may be possible to use this anywhere meat is required.

description.text: Used mostly by lumberjacks to fell trees.
Used by builders and blacksmiths.
Used to dig and move dirt around.
Used by miners to break apart rocks for the precious ores inside.
An essential tool for farming.
Used by naturalists to catch small specimens.
The barber's best friend and tool of the trade.
A butcher's close companion and tool of the trade.
A quality blade used by hunters and knife-fighters.
Used by carpenters to hew planks and logs.
It's a broom. You know, for cleaning!
Used for writing. Not, in fact, mightier than the sword.
This blade is covered in ancient runes and fresh blood.
It's a pistol.
A powerful handgun that can fire multiple times before reloading - its capacity should be more than enough to kill anything that moves.
It's a tripistol jury-rigged with extra-flints and a strange ceramic barrel.
It's a electric pistol.
It's an electric rifle.
A flame rifle used by officers of the Ministry of Occult Affairs.
Neither accurate nor quick-firing, The Empire was built on the discipline of soldiers firing these in whatever direction their commander orders them to.
This quick-firing rifle of Stahlmarkian design is mistrusted by senior officers.
A wholly dishonourable weapon, this rifle is accurate at long-range, allowing a soldier to fire upon their enemy without fear of reprisal.
Favoured for defending one's cottage or steam-carriage from ne'er-do-wells, this stout firearm may unleash a hail of shot at close range.
It's not a rocket launcher.
This is the weapon of an officer.
This is the weapon of an officer.
You can chop things with it.
One simply tosses this toward one's foe.
Why does the Empire rule as wide as it does? It is because we have the Minum Gun and They have not.
No mere soldier could fire this beastly weapon - its firepower is the province of the Steam Knight.
The Hand Cannon is the ultimate in Steam Knight firepower. It's powerful shell has been known to stop a raging Colossus Beetle at 100 yards.
A living gun made of gristle, flesh, and bone.
A squishy grenade bloated with foul goo.
This knife is carved from bone.
This club is made of spiny coral.
